alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Northern Blaine County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 2:29PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A few strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Blaine County through 400 PM MDT... At 225 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles west of Turner, or 28 miles northeast of Chinook, moving southeast at 20 mph. Scattered weaker storms were also moving southeast across central portions of Blaine county and Bears Paw Mountains and may intensify through 330 PM. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail with the strongest cells. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chinook, Harlem, Hays, Fort Belknap, Turner, Lodge Pole, Lloyd, Hogeland, Cleveland and Zurich. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
